intro: Draba verna proles revelierei, commonly known as the early whitlow grass, is a small, flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its low-growing habit, with basal leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. Native to alpine and arctic regions, this species thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and cool climates. It typically blooms in early spring, contributing to the early vegetation of its habitat. The plant is known for its resilience to harsh environmental conditions and is often found in mountainous areas across Europe and Asia.
